question: Which ratings agency estimated India’s economy to contract by 5% this fiscal, in its report 'Asia-Pacific losses near USD 3 tn as balance sheet recession looms'?
explanation:
S&P Global Ratings has recently released its report titled 'Asia-Pacific losses near USD 3 trillion as balance sheet recession looms'.
In the report, the agency revealed that Indian economy is in deep trouble. It also estimated that the Indian economy is expected to contract by 5 per cent this fiscal year. S&P also projected the Asia and Pacific region's economy to shrink by 1.3 per cent in 2020 and grow by 6.9 per cent in 2021. This implies a loss about USD 3 trillion output over the two years, from 2020 to 2022.
